page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is built near an old salt way.This came from Droitwich, it was taken to Fosse Way and was then distributed out around the Midlands. There is a park which has older children riding on motorbikes up and down the slide.There are 2 schools in Astwood Bank,a primary school and a middle school.The primary school is about 104 years old.The middle school was built in 1958 and was officially opened on the 15th January 1959. Sambourne was a village with many hunters,they used to hunt in the Arden forest.There is a public house called 'The Green Dragon.'This pub was used often on the days of hunts.There aren't many houses,but there is a monks bath and a trout farm.There is also an old derelict house which was once a school.
